Nit: what about:
```
# Use printf to properly escape newline symbols for jq.
printf -v cqurl "\n\nCommit Queue action: $GITHUB_SERVER_URL/${OWNER}/${REPOSITORY}/actions/runs/$GITHUB_RUN_ID"
```

The comment is a neat idea. I would still keep the `%s`s in case one of the variables includes a `%` or something like that. ```suggestion # Use printf to properly escape newline symbols for jq. printf -v cqurl "\n\nCommit Queue action: %s/%s/%s/actions/runs/%s" \ "$GITHUB_SERVER_URL" "${OWNER}" "${REPOSITORY}" "$GITHUB_RUN_ID" jq -n --arg content "
Commit Queue failed
$(cat output)
$cqurl" '{body: $content}' > output.json ```
